text: Which of the following land tenure systems allow a farmer to cultivate a piece of land in one growing season, at a fee?
explanation: In the context of land tenure systems,renting land typically involves paying a fee to use the land for a specified period.which can be as short as one growing season.

text: Agriculture could be made attractive to young people in West Africa through the.

options.A: fabrication of simple farm tools in a locality.
options.B: provision of basic amenities in rural areas.

explanation: Making agriculture attractive to young people often involves improving their quality of life and access to necessary service providing basic amenities in rural areas can make living and working in these regions more appealing

text: Which of the following agricultural programmes was mainly established to provide agricultural extension services?
explanation: The  Development Projects are geared towards providing agricultural extension services,The green Revolution focused on increasing food production through advanced technologies. Operation feed the Nation was a Nigerian initiative to increase self suficiancy in food.

text: The following tools are used in nursery operations except.
explanation: Nursery operation typically involves the use of tools that assist in planting and caring for young plants.

text: A major difference between disc harrow and a disc plough is that

options.A: disc plough has more discs than disc harrow
options.B: discs in disc plough are spaced far apart than in disc harrow.
options.C: disc plough has two pairs of gangs while disc harrow has one pair of gangs
options.D: disc plough has smaller discs than disc harrow.

explanation: A disc plough is designed for primary tillage ans has two sets of discs arranged in pairs which helps in turning over the soil.

text:
The diagram above illustrates a source of farm A power.

An advantage of using the power generated from the illustrated diagram is that it.

options.A: could be stored for future use
options.C: could be used for all farm operations

explanation: What we have in the diagram is a windmill,it generates wind power, A key advantage is that wind energy can be harnessed in many locations where wind conditions are favourable,making it widely available.

text:
The diagram above illustrates a source of form A power.
The power generated from the illustrated diagram could be converted to
explanation: The windmill generates mechanical power from wind,which can be converted into electrical energy.

text: Gunter's chain is used for?
explanation: Gunter's chain is a surveying instrument used for measuring distance,it is traditionally used in land surveying to measure distance accurately.

text: The chemical composition of soil is influenced by
explanation: Soil Composition is influenced by several factors,including parent material, The parent material from which the soil is derived greatly affects its chemical composition.

text: The ash produced after burning crop residues would.
explanation: Ash generally contains  basic compounds which can neutralize acids and decrease soil acidity.

text: A soil sample that contains predominantly mineral matter that are smaller than 0.002mm in size is,The diagram above illustrates a bag of compound fertilizer,use it to answer the questions.
explanation: Clay consists of very fine particles smaller than 0.002mm

text: The least nutrient in the illustrated bag of fertilizer is
explanation: The fertilizer is NPK fertilizer, the label 10-5-15 means it contains 10% nitrogen,5% phosphorus, and 15% potassium.

text: The plant nutrient which is responsible for the green colour of leaves
explanation: The green color of leaves is due to its chlorophyll content,magnesium is an important component of chlorophyl.

text: Determine the quantity of potassium in the illustrated bag of fertilizer
explanation:
Since the fertilizer contains 15% potassium,the quantity of potassium in  50kg bag
(15 ÷ 100) × 50kg = 7.5kg
The closest value is 8.3 kg

text: In order to check erosion on a sloping land, farmers are advised to make
explanation: In order to check erosion on a sloping land,construction of ridges across the slope is advised ; These ridges slow down water runoff and prevent the soil from being washed away.

text: The diagram above illustrates the root system of a crop. An example of a crop with the illustrated root system is?
explanation: Since what we have in the diagram is a taproot system,it is easy to associate it with plants like peas,beans and soya beans.

text: A bacterium that could be found in the part labeled I
explanation: The part labeled is called the root nodule,These nodules house the nitrogen fixing bacterial such as (Rhizobium),The bacterial help in symbiotic nitrogen fixation.

text: Which of the following fertilizers would not be required by the root system in the diagram above?
explanation: The part labeled is the root nodule,These nodules house nitrogen fixing bacterial such as (Rhizobium),The bacterial helps in symbiotic nitrogen fixation

text: An important limitation in the use of sprinkler irrigation system is that

options.A: soluble fertilizers and herbicides can not be applied with irrigation water
options.B: cannot be used on farmlands with high evapotranspiration rates
options.C: requires the use of large volume of water
options.D: high wind velocity could prevent uniform distribution of irrigation

explanation: A major limitation in the use of sprinkler irrigation system is that high wind velocity could prevent uniform distribution of irrigation water while sprinkler irrigation does require a significant volume of water,this is not a limitation in areas with adequate water supply.

text: Which of the following characteristics is not associated with monocotyledonous crops
explanation: Net venation is associated with dicotyledonous crops,monocots exhibit parallel venation

text: A crop that could be grown to serve as shade for a young cocoa plantation is
explanation: Banana,plantain and rubber tree are good examples of shade crops for cocoa

text: Molasses is a major by-product obtained from the processing of
explanation: Molasses is a thick dark liquid that is separated from the sugar crystals during the processing of sugar cane or sugar beets.

text:
The diagram above illustrates a storage structure for crops,use it to answer questions 23 to 25

Which of the following crops are best preserved in the illustrated storage structure?
explanation: The structure shown is a traditional crib used for storing grains,Maize cobs are best preserved in this structures as they need good ventilation to prevent mould growth.

text: The function of the part labeled I is to
explanation: The part labeled I is the elevation of the structure on the pillars. This design helps in preventing attack by rodents and other ground dwelling-dwelling pests.

text: Which of the following environmental conditions would cause spoilage of crops stored in the illustrated structure?

options.A: High temperature and low relative humidity
options.B: Low temperature and high relative humidity
options.C: High rainfall and high wind velocity
options.D: Low rainfall and low wind velocity

explanation: High humidity induces moisture accumulation stored crops.Thus causes mold growth and spoilage,Also,low temperature ca worsen the situation.

text: The correct sequence of land preparation for the cultivation of yam is
explanation: The correct sequence is clearing-stumping-ploughing-harrowing-ridging

text: Tenera is a cultivated variety of oil with a

options.A: Thin mesocarp, thick endocarp and large kernel.
options.B: Thick mesocarp,thin endocarp and a moderate sized kernel
options.C: Thick mesocarp,absence of endocarp and a small kernel.
options.D: Thin mesocarp,thin endocarp and a moderate sized kernel.

explanation: Tenera is a hybrid variety of palm oil derived from crossing Dura and pisifera oil palms,tenera also has thick mesocarp,thin endocarp and a moderate sized kernel.

text:
Use the information below to answer questions 28 and 29.
A farmer produced 25 tonnes of cocoa,if 16 bags of cocoa was later sold at 350.00 per kilogram.(1 tonne = 1,000 kg) 
Determine the income realized by the farmer.
explanation:
Total weight in Kg = (25 × 100) kg
since the price per kg is #350, total amount realized = # (25,000 × 350) = #8,750,000

text: Calculate the cost of one bag of cocoa.
explanation:
Since they are 16 bags per tonne,the entire 25 tonnes will contain (16 × 25) bags = 400 bags.
since the total amount realized is # 8,750,000, cost per bag = #8,750,000 ÷ 400 = #21,875.

text: A disadvantage of selection as a method of crop improvement is that it.

options.B: requires expertise when carrying it out
options.D: increases the susceptibility of crops to pests

explanation: A disadvantage of selection as a method of crop improvement is that it increase the susceptibility of crops to pests.

text: Natural regeneration of forests may lead to

options.B: requires expertise when carrying it out
options.D: increases the susceptibility of of crops to pests

explanation: Trees grow at different rates and densities, leading to non - uniform forest stands.

text:
The diagram above illustrates the damage on a leaf caused by an insect pest of crops.
Use it answer questions 32 and 33.
The damage to the illustrated leaf is mostly caused by
explanation: Many beetles chew holes in the leaves leaving them with a ragged appearance ,this is typical of beetles like the Japanese beetle and flea beetle.

text: The biological process that would be affected in the leaf is
explanation: Since the leaf is a main organ for photosynthesis ,the process that will be affected is photosynthesis

text: The yield of palm oil could be reduced by infestation
explanation: Caterpillar infestation can significantly reduce the yield of palm oil palm,leaf miner caterpillar ( coelanomenoderalemeensis)

text: Breeds of sheep common in west Africa include
explanation: Quad and yankassa are very common West African breeds. These breeds are well adapted to the reqional climate.

text: Low relative humidity in livestock pens would
explanation: Low humidity in livestock pens can led to dry and irritated respiratory tracts making animals more susceptible to diseases.

text: A poultry farmer collects 100 trays of eggs per day on the farm. If the market price of a tray of eggs is #900.00, determine the income realized from the sale of eggs in one week
explanation:
Number of trays collected in a day = 100.In one week,we have 7 × 100 trays = 700 trays.
As the price of the tray is 900#, the total income is 700 × #900 = #630,000

text: Which of the following is an advantage of pen mating?

options.B: deformed males may not be allowed to mate.
options.C: cost of keeping a breeding male is low
options.D: the tendency of mating females on heat is high

explanation: In pen mating,a single male can mate with multiple females, which reduces the need for multiple breeding males and lowers the associated ones

text: Pail feeding is commonly practiced in the management of?
explanation: Pail feeding typically involves feeding piglets milk or milk replacer using pails,especially in situation where the sow cannot adequately nurse all her piglets.

text:
The diagram above illustrates a management practice in poultry production,use it to answer question 40 to 42.
The management practice illustrated in the diagram is?
explanation: The management illustrated is called in the diagram is called brooding,brooding is the period after hatching during which the chicks are kept warm and provided with appropriate care until they are able to regulate their own body temperature.

text: Climatic factors that should be monitored during the management practice illustrated are temperature.
explanation:
Temperature: Correct temperature is crucial for the health and growth of chicks.
Relative humidity: Proper humidity levels are important to maintain during brooding tp prevent dehydration and ensure comfort
Day length: day length does not typically need to be monitored  during brooding.

text: The illustrated management is usually carried on chicks from day old to
explanation: Brooding is usually carried out in chicks from day old to 6 weeks.

text: The meat from a tender calf is
explanation: Veal meat is the meat from young calves typically around 3 to 16 weeks old,known for its tender texture and mild flavor compared to beef from older cattle.

text: Which of the following group of diseases of farm animals are caused by bacteria?
explanation: Brucellosis,anthrax and tuberculosis are all caused by bacterial

text: If an animal is likely to succumb to the effects of a pathogen,the animal is said to be.
explanation: An animal is said to be susceptible when it is likely affected by or vulnerable to a disease,infection or other harmful conditions.

text: Which of the following changes will cause the demand curve to shift to the right?

options.A: A reduction in the size of the population
options.B: An increase in the income of the consumer
options.D: Decrease in the price of goods

explanation: click here

text: The function of a farm manager is to

options.A: make agricultural policies for the government
options.B: allocate available resources on the farm effectively
options.D: stabilize the prices of farm produce

explanation: A farm manager oversees daily operations,plans and organizes production,manages resources and and supervises personnel.

text: Marginal cost could be described as as the

options.A: change in total cost of output
options.B: product of average variable cost and the number of fruits produced
options.C: increase in fixed cost of that results from increasing production by one unit
options.D: average physical product mutiplied by the variable cost

explanation: Marginal cost is the additional cost incurred by producing more than one more unit of a good or service.

text: Farm gate price is mostly enjoyed by
explanation: Farm gate price refers to the price farmers (producers) receive for their products at the point of sale, directly from their farm to the production site.
